metadata.feature_description: Retrieve and manage URL management options including locales, status codes, and site aliases

steps.action: Navigated to Pages > Home > Advanced > S.E.O. tab
steps.expected: S.E.O. settings panel should load with URL configuration options
steps.actual: S.E.O. panel loaded successfully showing URLs for the page

steps.action: Clicked Add URL button to open the URL creation form
steps.expected: Add URL form should display with Site Alias dropdown
steps.actual: Add URL form opened with Site Alias, URL Path, and URL Type fields

steps.action: Opened Site Alias dropdown to view available locales
steps.expected: Dropdown should show all configured site aliases with locale suffixes
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed 6 site aliases: localhost:8081 (default), localhost:8081/ar-er (Arabic), localhost:8081/de-de (German), localhost:8081/en-us (English), localhost:8081/es-ar (Spanish), localhost:8081/fr-fr (French)

steps.action: Opened URL Type dropdown in Add URL form
steps.expected: Dropdown should show available HTTP status codes for URLs
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed 2 status codes: Active (200) for active URLs and Redirect (301) for redirect URLs

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Retrieve site aliases and primary alias

steps.expected: All configured site aliases should be listed
steps.actual: 6 site aliases retrieved successfully: localhost:8081 (primary/default), localhost:8081/ar-er, localhost:8081/de-de, localhost:8081/en-us, localhost:8081/es-ar, localhost:8081/fr-fr

steps.expected: Current locale alias should be pre-selected
steps.actual: localhost:8081/en-us was pre-selected as the current locale, indicating proper alias detection

steps.action: Reviewed Add URL form for site alias usage configuration
steps.expected: Site alias usage options should be available in URL configuration
steps.actual: Site alias usage is handled internally by the system. The Add URL form uses the selected site alias with automatic usage type determination. Custom URLs can be associated with specific aliases, and the system manages inheritance and child page URL behavior automatically.

steps.action: Verified locale flags in site header
steps.expected: Locale flags should match configured site aliases
steps.actual: Site header showed 5 locale flags matching the configured aliases: English (US), Spanish (Argentina), French (France), German (Germany), Arabic (Eritrea)

steps.action: Cross-referenced Site Alias dropdown with locale configuration
steps.expected: Each site alias should correspond to a configured locale
steps.actual: All 5 language locales plus the default alias were properly configured and accessible in the URL options

steps.action: Viewed URLs table for the Home page
steps.expected: Primary alias should generate automatic system URL
steps.actual: The root URL '/' was shown with URL Type 'Active (200)' and Generated By 'Automatic', indicating it was automatically generated for the primary alias

steps.action: Compared automatic URL with custom URLs
steps.expected: Custom URLs should show user as generator
steps.actual: Custom URLs (/redirect-url-edited and /test-url-alpha) showed 'SuperUser Account' as generator with Redirect (301) status, while the primary alias URL showed 'Automatic' generation

observations: The site is configured as a multi-locale setup with 5 languages: English (US), Spanish (Argentina), French (France), German (Germany), and Arabic (Eritrea)
Each locale has a corresponding site alias with a locale suffix (e.g., localhost:8081/en-us, localhost:8081/es-ar)
The primary alias (localhost:8081) serves as the default without a locale suffix
Site alias usage options (Default, ChildPagesInherit, etc.) from GetUrlOptions() API are managed internally and not exposed as a separate UI dropdown in the simple Add URL form
The URL Type dropdown correctly displays the two supported status codes: Active (200) and Redirect (301), matching the source code implementation
